skill.name: security-sentinel
skill.description: Use when working with authentication, API routes, user input, or sensitive data. Audits code for security vulnerabilities based on OWASP Top 10. Critical for payment processing, auth systems, and data handling.
skill.summary: Use when working with authentication, API routes, user input, or sensitive data. Audits code for sec...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate security education and documentation skill. All 1267 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the files contain educational code examples showing vulnerable patterns (marked as 'DON'T') alongside secure alternatives. The skill includes a defensive security scanner for detecting vulnerabilities. No malicious intent found.

content.user_title: Secure Your Next.js 15 Apps with OWASP Best Practices
content.value_statement: Build secure applications by following OWASP Top 10 guidelines. This comprehensive reference includes authentication patterns, vulnerability prevention guides, and automated security scanning for your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete OWASP Top 10 documentation with vulnerable and secure code examples
Includes authentication and authorization patterns for JWT, sessions, OAuth, and MFA
Offers input validation patterns using Zod for forms, files, and API routes
Contains automated Python vulnerability scanner that detects 20+ security issues
Delivers pre-deployment security checklist with 250+ audit items
Covers CSRF prevention, rate limiting, and secret management best practices
limitations: Scanner requires Python 3 and does not run inside the AI execution environment
Does not automatically fix vulnerabilities - provides guidance for manual remediation
Security patterns are documentation-based; actual implementation requires developer action

use_cases.title: Secure API implementation
use_cases.description: Implement authentication and authorization in Next.js 15 API routes following OWASP guidelines

use_cases.title: Code review automation
use_cases.description: Run automated security scans on codebases to identify vulnerabilities before deployment

use_cases.title: Pre-deployment security audit
use_cases.description: Validate all security requirements are met using comprehensive checklist before production release

prompt_templates.title: Auth implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: Add user authentication to Next.js app
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement secure JWT authentication in Next.js 15 with proper token refresh, HttpOnly cookies, and authorization middleware

prompt_templates.title: Input validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Zod schema to validate user registration input including email format, password strength requirements, and prevent SQL injection

prompt_templates.title: XSS prevention
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I safely render user-generated HTML in Next.js without XSS vulnerabilities? Show DOMPurify integration and Content Security Policy headers

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this code for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities. Check for broken access control, injection risks, and missing security headers

output_examples.input: How do I prevent SQL injection in my Drizzle ORM queries?
output: âœ… ALWAYS use parameterized queries with Drizzle ORM
const user = await db.users.findUnique({ where: { email } })
âŒ NEVER use string interpolation: `SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = '${email}'`
For dynamic filters, use Drizzle's query builder with proper typing
Validate all input with Zod before passing to database queries

output_examples.input: Set up rate limiting for my authentication API
output: Implement sliding window rate limiting for login attempts
Use Redis for distributed rate limiting across instances
Block IP addresses after 5 failed attempts for 15 minutes
Log rate limit violations for security monitoring

output_examples.input: What security headers should I set in Next.js?

best_practices: Validate all user input with Zod schemas before processing - never trust client data
Use parameterized queries only - never concatenate strings in database operations
Hash passwords with bcrypt (12+ rounds) or Argon2, and store JWT secrets in environment variables
anti_patterns: Using eval() or Function() with user input - leads to code execution vulnerabilities
Storing secrets in source code or hardcoded strings - use environment variables only
Returning sensitive data (passwords, tokens) in API responses - always filter response objects

faq.question: Does this skill run security scans automatically?
faq.answer: The skill provides a Python scanner script. Run it separately with 'python validate-security.py src/' to scan your codebase.

faq.question: What authentication methods are covered?
faq.answer: JWT tokens, session cookies, OAuth 2.0, magic links, TOTP MFA, and passwordless authentication patterns.

faq.question: Can this prevent all security vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: No tool guarantees complete security. This skill provides patterns and checks - developers must implement them correctly.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Next.js 15?
faq.answer: Yes, all examples use App Router patterns, Server Actions, and modern Next.js 15 security features.

faq.question: Does the scanner check TypeScript files?
faq.answer: Yes, the Python scanner detects vulnerabilities in .ts, .tsx, .js, and .jsx files while excluding node_modules.

faq.question: How often should I run security checks?
faq.answer: Run security scans before every commit and deployment. Use the checklist for final pre-release validation.
